content.question: Which of the following explains a potentially negative consequence of executive term limits?

choices.label: Executive term limits usually harm consistent application of rule of law.
Executive term limits can force effective executives out of office.
Executive term limits make the legislative branch too strong.

content.answer: Executive term limits can force effective executives out of office.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
